titles.title: AIDS Assault Act of 1988
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide penalties for knowingly engaging in conduct that is likely to transmit the disease commonly called AIDS, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 3/29/1988--Introduced. AIDS Assault Act of 1988 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide criminal penalties for any person who, under certain circumstances, engages in conduct knowing or having reason to believe that such conduct will infect another person with AIDS. Amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to promulgate regulations requiring entities which collect or distribute blood or blood components or derivatives, in order to receive a license under such Act, to permit directed and autologous blood donations.
